explicit

Class MDPModelChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • explicit.StateModelChecker
        • explicit.NonProbModelChecker
          • explicit.ProbModelChecker
            • explicit.MDPModelChecker

  • public class MDPModelChecker
extends ProbModelChecker
    Explicit-state model checker for Markov decision processes (MDPs).

        public ModelCheckerResult computeNextProbs(MDP mdp,
                                           java.util.BitSet target,
                                           boolean min)
                                    throws PrismException
        Compute next=state probabilities. i.e. compute the probability of being in a state in target in the next step.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeRestrictedNext

        public double[] computeRestrictedNext(MDP mdp,
                                      java.util.BitSet a,
                                      double[] x,
                                      boolean min)
        Given a value vector x, compute the probability: v(s) = min/max sched [ Sum_s' P_sched(s,s')*x(s') ] for s labeled with a, v(s) = 0 for s not labeled with a. Clears the StateValues object x.
        Parameters:
        tr - the transition matrix
        a - the set of states labeled with a
        x - the value vector
        min - compute min instead of max

                                     throws PrismException
        Compute reachability probabilities. i.e. compute the min/max probability of reaching a state in target.

      • computeUntilProbs

        public ModelCheckerResult computeUntilProbs(MDP mdp,
                                            java.util.BitSet remain,
                                            java.util.BitSet target,
                                            boolean min)
                                     throws PrismException
        Compute until probabilities. i.e. compute the min/max probability of reaching a state in target, while remaining in those in remain.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        remain - Remain in these states (optional: null means "all")
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeReachProbs

        public ModelCheckerResult computeReachProbs(MDP mdp,
                                            java.util.BitSet remain,
                                            java.util.BitSet target,
                                            boolean min,
                                            double[] init,
                                            java.util.BitSet known)
                                     throws PrismException
        Compute reachability/until probabilities. i.e. compute the min/max probability of reaching a state in target, while remaining in those in remain.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        remain - Remain in these states (optional: null means "all")
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (may be overwritten)
        known - Optionally, a set of states for which the exact answer is known Note: if 'known' is specified (i.e. is non-null, 'init' must also be given and is used for the exact values). Also, 'known' values cannot be passed for some solution methods, e.g. policy iteration.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeReachProbsNumeric

        protected ModelCheckerResult computeReachProbsNumeric(MDP mdp,
                                                      ProbModelChecker.MDPSolnMethod method,
                                                      java.util.BitSet no,
                                                      java.util.BitSet yes,

                                                      java.util.BitSet known,
                                                      int[] strat)

      • prob0

        public java.util.BitSet prob0(MDPGeneric<?> mdp,
                              java.util.BitSet remain,
                              java.util.BitSet target,
                              boolean min,
                              int[] strat)
        Prob0 precomputation algorithm. i.e. determine the states of an MDP which, with min/max probability 0, reach a state in target, while remaining in those in remain. min=true gives Prob0E, min=false gives Prob0A. Optionally, for min only, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info for 0 states.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        remain - Remain in these states (optional: null means "all")
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • prob1

        public java.util.BitSet prob1(MDPGeneric<?> mdp,
                              java.util.BitSet remain,
                              java.util.BitSet target,
                              boolean min,
                              int[] strat)
        Prob1 precomputation algorithm. i.e. determine the states of an MDP which, with min/max probability 1, reach a state in target, while remaining in those in remain. min=true gives Prob1A, min=false gives Prob1E. Optionally, for max only, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info for 1 states.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        remain - Remain in these states (optional: null means "all")
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

                                                            MDPRewards prodCosts,
                                                            java.util.BitSet progStates)
                                                     throws PrismException
        Compute reachability probabilities using value iteration. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        progStates -
        mdp - The MDP
        no - Probability 0 states
        yes - Probability 1 states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (will be overwritten)
        known - Optionally, a set of states for which the exact answer is known
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null) Note: if 'known' is specified (i.e. is non-null, 'init' must also be given and is used for the exact values.

        PrismException

        Compute reachability probabilities using value iteration. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        no - Probability 0 states
        yes - Probability 1 states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (will be overwritten)
        known - Optionally, a set of states for which the exact answer is known
        iterationMethod - The iteration method
        topological - Do topological value iteration?
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null) Note: if 'known' is specified (i.e. is non-null), 'init' must also be given and is used for the exact values.

        PrismException

        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeReachProbsGaussSeidel

        protected ModelCheckerResult computeReachProbsGaussSeidel(MDP mdp,
                                                          java.util.BitSet no,
                                                          java.util.BitSet yes,
                                                          boolean min,
                                                          double[] init,
                                                          java.util.BitSet known,
                                                          int[] strat)
                                                   throws PrismException
        Compute reachability probabilities using Gauss-Seidel (including Jacobi-style updates).
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        no - Probability 0 states
        yes - Probability 1 states
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (will be overwritten)
        known - Optionally, a set of states for which the exact answer is known
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null) Note: if 'known' is specified (i.e. is non-null, 'init' must also be given and is used for the exact values.
        Throws:
        PrismException

                                                           boolean min,
                                                           double[] lastSoln)
                                                    throws PrismException
        Construct strategy information for min/max reachability probabilities. (More precisely, list of indices of choices resulting in min/max.) (Note: indices are guaranteed to be sorted in ascending order.)

        mdp - The MDP
        state - The state to generate strategy info for
        target - The set of target states to reach
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        lastSoln - Vector of values from which to recompute in one iteration

        PrismException

                                                   int k,
                                                   boolean min)

                                                   double[] results)

        target - Target states
        k - Bound
        min - Min or max probabilities (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (may be overwritten)
        results - Optional array of size k+1 to store (init state) results for each step (null if unused)

      • isContracting

        private boolean isContracting(MDP mdp,
                              java.util.BitSet unknown,
                              java.util.BitSet target)
        Return true if the MDP is contracting for all states in the 'unknown' set, i.e., if Pmin=1( unknown U target) holds.

      • computeReachRewards

        public ModelCheckerResult computeReachRewards(MDP mdp,
                                              MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                              java.util.BitSet target,
                                              boolean min,
                                              double[] init,
                                              java.util.BitSet known)
                                       throws PrismException
        Compute expected reachability rewards. i.e. compute the min/max reward accumulated to reach a state in target.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        target - Target states
        min - Min or max rewards (true=min, false=max)
        init - Optionally, an initial solution vector (may be overwritten)
        known - Optionally, a set of states for which the exact answer is known Note: if 'known' is specified (i.e. is non-null, 'init' must also be given and is used for the exact values). Also, 'known' values cannot be passed for some solution methods, e.g. policy iteration.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeReachRewardsPolIter

        protected ModelCheckerResult computeReachRewardsPolIter(MDP mdp,
                                                        MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                                        java.util.BitSet target,
                                                        java.util.BitSet inf,
                                                        boolean min,
                                                        int[] strat)
                                                 throws PrismException
        Compute expected reachability rewards using policy iteration. The array strat is used both to pass in the initial strategy for policy iteration, and as storage for the resulting optimal strategy (if needed). Passing in an initial strategy is required when some states have infinite reward, to avoid the possibility of policy iteration getting stuck on an infinite-value strategy.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        target - Target states
        inf - States for which reward is infinite
        min - Min or max rewards (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        Throws:
        PrismException

                                                          boolean min,

        target - The set of target states to reach
